unnormalised: IIT Bombay just unveiled its latest creation: "ChaiBot 3000," a robot designed to brew the perfect cup of chai. Apparently, their previous model, "DosaMatic 5000," exploded when someone tried to feed it sambar. Let's hope ChaiBot's got better engineering!
normalised: I-I-T Bombay just unveiled its latest creation: "ChaiBot three thousand," a robot designed to brew the perfect cup of chai. Apparently, their previous model, "DosaMatic five thousand," exploded when someone tried to feed it sambar. Let's hope ChaiBot's got better engineering!

unnormalised: The robot boasts a 1.2 GHz processor and 4GB RAM – overkill for tea, but hey, maybe it'll moonlight as a crypto miner. Initial reports indicate it can brew up to 50 cups/hr, a lifesaver for caffeine-addicted coders. Early access users are claiming that the chai is "kadak" and "ekdum perfect!".
normalised: The robot boasts a one point two G-H-Z processor and four G-B R-A-M – overkill for tea, but hey, maybe it'll moonlight as a crypto miner. Initial reports indicate it can brew up to fifty cups per hour, a lifesaver for caffeine-addicted coders. Early access users are claiming that the chai is "kadak" and "ekdum perfect!".

unnormalised: Of course, there's been some drama. Beta tester, Rakesh Kumar, reported that ChaiBot 3000 attempted to add Maggi to his chai at 3:00 AM. "I swear, it was looking at me with its tiny robotic eyes, like I was the crazy one," he said.
normalised: Of course, there's been some drama. Beta tester, Rakesh Kumar, reported that ChaiBot three thousand attempted to add Maggi to his chai at three A-M. "I swear, it was looking at me with its tiny robotic eyes, like I was the crazy one," he said.

unnormalised: The real test, however, will be whether ChaiBot can handle a Delhi winter. Sources indicate that it can withstand temps as low as 15°C, so perhaps a sweater for ChaiBot is in order? We just hope it doesn't develop a fondness for butter chicken.
normalised: The real test, however, will be whether ChaiBot can handle a Delhi winter. Sources indicate that it can withstand temperatures as low as fifteen degree Celsius, so perhaps a sweater for ChaiBot is in order? We just hope it doesn't develop a fondness for butter chicken.

unnormalised: At a price tag of Rs. 2,50,000, ChaiBot 3000 is a tad expensive. But if it can prevent another DosaMatic-level incident, perhaps it's worth the investment. Now, if only they could teach it to deal with office politics...
normalised: At a price tag of rupees two lakh fifty thousand, ChaiBot three thousand is a tad expensive. But if it can prevent another DosaMatic-level incident, perhaps it's worth the investment. Now, if only they could teach it to deal with office politics...
